description: first floor side extension; single and two storey side to rear extension; first floor extension to other side; replacement roof; rear dormer; external alterations
decision_conditions:
<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 0cm; line-height: normal;">The
proposed first floor side extension, by reason of its overall scale, siting and position
would result in the enclosure of the gap between the host dwelling and the
boundary shared with No. 79 Belmont Lane. This would adversely affect the overall
detached character and appearance of the host dwelling and its contribution to
the wider street scene and would detract from the established pattern of
development within the immediate area. As such, the proposal is therefore
considered contrary to the high quality design aspirations of the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), policy D3 (D(1) and D(11)) of The London Plan
(2021), policy CS1.B of The Harrow Core Strategy (2012), Policy DM1 of the
Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013) and the adopted
Supplementary Planning Document Residential Design Guide (2010).</p>

<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: 0cm; line-height: normal;">The proposed roof alterations would result
in an enlarged roof space and revised roof profile that would dwarf the
existing gable fronted roof. This would not respect the host dwelling and would
fail to be a subservient addition to the original dwelling and would adversely impact
upon the character and appearance of the host dwelling. As such, the proposal is therefore considered contrary to the high
quality design aspirations of the National Planning Policy Framework (2023),
policy D3 (D(1) and D(11)) of The London Plan (2021), policy CS1.B of The
Harrow Core Strategy (2012), Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management
Policies Local Plan (2013) and the adopted Supplementary Planning Document
Residential Design Guide (2010).<font face="Arial, sans-serif"><span style="font-size: 12pt;"><o:p></o:p></span></font></p>
